Description: Portrait of Dominique Vivant Denon, half-length, turned to left, his head turned to the viewer; apparently used as a frontispiece to Denon, 'Travels in Upper and Lower Egypt'. c. 1804 Lithograph
Curator's comments: The print may be the frontispiece that was advertised as appearing in an English translation of Denon's 'Travels in upper and Lower Egypt' published by John Bell, which was advertised in the Morning Post of 21st April 1804 as 'the first and only complete edition', having 'a portrait of the author, after an etching by himself, and now copied correctly after a process of printing from stone, without engraving or etching' (information from Michael Kassler). The print is based on Denon's self-portrait after a drawing by Isabey (IFF 271; Chu 153; impression in BM: 1881,0611.20) which was used as the frontispiece to Denon's "Voyage en Egypte", 1802. The present impression is pasted into a volume of early English lithographs, described as "Specimens of Polyautography", compiled before c.1820. The sheet to which it is attached has a watermark dated 1816, but the print itself carries no date. Man (Felix H Man, "Lithography in England (1801-1810)", in C. Zigrosser (ed.), "Prints" (1962), p. 117) dated it on stylistic grounds to 1806, taking a view of the technical progress of lithography in England in the years after the earliest English lithographs were made in 1801; the keys to his dating were a certain number of dated prints, notably a set of twelve published in 1803 by Philipp André, and sets of thirty-six and at least five published in 1806 and 1806/07 by G J Vollweiler. Few lithographs were produced in the next decade before the technique was taken up by Ackermann and Hullmandel in 1818. Man transcribes the printmaker's name as "Arnold", but does not identify him; the ink is blotted and the name may be "Arnald", i.e., George Arnald, the painter.
Bibliographic references: Man 1962 / Lithography in England 1801-10 (with a catalogue of 165 prints) (12)
Associated names: Portrait of: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated titles: Travels in Upper and Lower Egypt
